title: The infamous replacement of the Mayoral Vehicle in Elias Motsoaled Municipality.
text:
The infamous replacement of the Mayoral Vehicle in Elias Motsoaled Municipality.
In August of 2015 a report was submitted to Council (M15/16) that consideration (serious for that matter) should be given to the replacement of the Mayoral vehicle for which its maintenance cost has outrun its worth.
A Vehicle that was only purchased by Council during December 2011 and is standard with all Mercedes Benz Vehicles includes a 5 year maintenance plan, which would only expire in December 2016.
It is therefore amazing to notice that the agenda mentions maintenance and other expenses incurred over the past 4 years as being sufficient reasons for the replacement of the vehicle.
Depreciation on the vehicles is calculated at 20% per annum which today has 15 month left of depreciation and as the trade in value of vehicle would exceed its book value at this point in time, the question that needs to be asked is whether the profit on disposal of fixed assets would be accounted for in terms of GAAP and whether the replacement of the vehicle was in any way included in the 2015/16 financial budget?
That the vehicle at this point in time would need to be replaced is questionable as the use of the vehicle for Mayoral duties are very restricted as the cost of the new vehicle which would most probably be in excess of R 1 million despite the limit placed on official vehicles by the previous Minister of Finance for Ministers being R 750 000 so the budget for Mayoral Vehicles would in any case be much less than this.
It is ironic that the Mayor might only have 9 month left of her tenure and now need the replacement of the vehicle to be considered a priority over other needed infrastructure development costs that is in dire need. When a new Mayor is elected in 2016 would the need once again be to replace the vehicle to suit to needs of the new incumbent?
Expenditure of this nature should not be condoned and or being applicable and or preference over service and infrastructure development and the lack thereof as it currently stand.
What now makes the situation even more bizarre is that Fleet Horizon (yes the infamous company) was already asked to Quote: on a replacement vehicle in April of 2015, 4 months prior to it being tabled in Council for recommendation and action to be followed. This cost of the vehicle then being over R 950 000 which has now escalated to over R 1.2 million which is money that could have been spent most wisely on infrastructure development than to transport the Mayor in sumptuous luxury around for maybe just another 9 months!
